definition: to stick up/to point sth up
to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: He sighs, and wipes stray bread crumbs from his beard, rising to his cloven feet.
sentences.chinese: 他嘆了口氣，抹掉沾在鬍子上的麪包屑，翹起二郎腿。

sentences.english: Something was lifting from the ground when a car was going that close to the left wall.
sentences.chinese: 當車子靠近左牆開過時，地上似乎就有什麼翹起來。

sentences.english: Consequently, the endings of the hair cluster appear to have been somewhat raised up.
sentences.chinese: 結果，那撮虎毛的未端顯得有些翹起來。

sentences.english: You will notice that with your flaps down, your nose has a tendency to rise.
sentences.chinese: 你會發現，隨着襟翼的放下，你的機頭會向上翹起。

sentences.english: So she tilted the hat till she could see the gate and road.
sentences.chinese: 她把帽子翹起來一點，直到能夠看見路。

sentences.english: He cocked his feet up on the desk.
sentences.chinese: 他翹起雙腿放在書桌上。

sentences.english: Raise your butt so I can spank it.
sentences.chinese: 把你的屁股翹起來我才能打你屁股。

sentences.english: He raises his shoe to unlace it, and catches the sight of the slippers.
sentences.chinese: 他翹起一隻腳來解鞋帶，看見了拖鞋。

sentences.english: She curled up her lips with disapproval.
sentences.chinese: 她不以爲然地翹起了嘴脣。

sentences.english: If he’s carrying his tail tall and proud, he’s happy.
sentences.chinese: 如果尾巴高翹起而且很得意，說明它很開心。

sentences.english: The front end lifted a few more inches.
sentences.chinese: 底板的前端又翹起了幾英寸。

sentences.english: Ciliatus forewing length and tilt, such as the caudate chicken.
sentences.chinese: 前翅緣毛長並翹起如雞尾狀。

sentences.english: On the map that promontory looks like a nose, naughtily turned up.
sentences.chinese: 從地圖上年，那個海角就像一隻調皮地翹起來的鼻子。

sentences.english: Have a cup of tea, put your feet up and stare out of the window.
sentences.chinese: 泡一杯茶，翹起你的腳凝視窗外。

sentences.english: The knife crumpled up and hurt him; he put his finger in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 餐刀弄彎了，翹起來弄傷了他，他把手指放進嘴裏。

definition: perfectly round/(fig.) accommodating/considerate/smooth (way of doing things)
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
to close (flower, eyes, suitcase etc)/to bring together/(insect or bird when not flying) to fold (its wings)
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
